content: National rating on multiple scales The following are some [international rankings](/wiki/List_of_international_rankings) for [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Communications - Singapore is ranked 1st globally for average fixed broadband download speed (Oookla, July, 2025). - Singapore ranked 4th out of 133 economies in the 2024 Global Innovation Index ## Demographics - [CIA](/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency) [World Factbook](/wiki/The_World_Factbook): [Total fertility rate](/wiki/Total_fertility_rate) 2014 estimate, ranked 224 out of 224 countries (0.80) - [Population density](/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_population_density) ranked 3 out of 242 countries - [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations): [Population](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_population) ranked 114 out of 233 countries - United Nations: World Population Policies 2005 [number of immigrants](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_immigrant_population), ranked 22 out of 192 countries - International Organization for Migration: 7th most cosmopolitan nation. ## Economy - Singapore is ranked first worldwide for the ease of doing business by the World Bank for 2012, consecutively for 7 years. - Singapore is ranked the #1 most competitive country in the world. - Singapore is the 14th most expensive city in the world to spend a night in. - [The Economist](/wiki/The_Economist): [Where-to-be-born Index](/wiki/Where-to-be-born_Index) 2013, ranked 6 out of 111 countries - As of March 2024[update], Singapore's [external debt](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_external_debt) ranked 16 out of 202 countries. - [Foreign exchange reserves](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_foreign_exchange_reserves) ranked 10 out of 121 countries - [Nominal GDP](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)) — - [IMF](/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund): ranked 36 out of 188 countries (2014) - [World Bank](/wiki/World_Bank): ranked 36 out of 189 countries (2014) - [Nominal GDP growth rate](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)_growth_rate) 2014 estimate: ranked 99 out of 198 countries - [Nominal GDP per capita](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)_per_capita) — - [IMF](/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund): ranked 6 out of 186 countries (2015) - [GDP (PPP) per capita](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(PPP)_per_capita) — - [IMF](/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund): ranked 2 out of 186 countries (2025) - [World Bank](/wiki/World_Bank): ranked 3 out of 185 countries (2014) - [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations): [Human Development Index](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Human_Development_Index) 2024, ranked 9 out of 193 countries - [The Heritage Foundation](/wiki/The_Heritage_Foundation)/*[The Wall Street Journal](/wiki/The_Wall_Street_Journal)*: *[Index of Economic Freedom](/wiki/Index_of_Economic_Freedom)* 2021, *[Index of Economic Freedom](/wiki/Index_of_Economic_Freedom)* 1st out of 178 countries - World Economic Forum: [Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Index](/wiki/Travel_and_Tourism_Competitiveness_Report) 2013, ranked 10 out of 140 countries - [World Tourism Organization](/wiki/World_Tourism_Organization): [World Tourism rankings](/wiki/World_Tourism_rankings), ranked 29 out of all countries - Singapore has claimed the top position in the 2025 Global Talent Competitiveness Index (GTCI) for the first time, bolstered by its robust education systems, sound governance and a proactive approach to sustaining an adaptive, innovation-ready workforce in the age of artificial intelligence. ## Education - Ranked 1 in the 2015 [OECD](/wiki/OECD) global education report ## Energy - CIA World Factbook: refined petroleum consumption 2015, ranked 18 out of 215 countries - CIA World Factbook: [oil consumption](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_oil_consumption) 2012, ranked 78 out of 211 countries ## Environment - [CIA](/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency) [World Factbook](/wiki/The_World_Factbook): [water resources](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_total_renewable_water_resources) (2011 figures), ranked 160 out of 172 countries - [New Economics Foundation](/wiki/New_Economics_Foundation): [Happy Planet Index](/wiki/Happy_Planet_Index) 2012, ranked 90 out of 151 countries - [US Department of Energy](/wiki/US_Department_of_Energy): [CO2 emissions per capita](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_carbon_dioxide_emissions_per_capita) 2008, ranked 58 out of 214 countries - [Save The Children](/wiki/Save_the_Children): End of Childhood report 2018, ranked 1 out of 175 countries ## Geography - [CIA](/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency) [World Factbook](/wiki/The_World_Factbook): [Total area](/wiki/List_of_countries_and_outlying_territories_by_total_area) ranked 190 out of 249 countries and oceans ## Labour - Singapore is ranked 47 out of 148 countries on the [World Economic Forum](/wiki/World_Economic_Forum) Global Gender Gap Report. ## Military - [List of countries by Global Militarization Index](/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Global_Militarization_Index): ranked 8 out of 149 countries ## Politics and law - In 2022, Singapore was ranked 17th in the world in the [Rule of Law](/wiki/Rule_of_Law) Index by the [World Justice Project](/wiki/World_Justice_Project). - *The Economist*: [Democracy Index](/wiki/Democracy_Index) 2018, ranked 66 out of 167 countries - [Reporters Without Borders](/wiki/Reporters_Without_Borders): [Worldwide Press Freedom Index](/wiki/Press_Freedom_Index#Worldwide_Press_Freedom_Index) 2017: ranked 151 out of 180 countries ## Technology - [UN](/wiki/UN) [e-Government Readiness Index](/wiki/E-Government#UN_e-Government_Readiness_Index), Singapore ranks 3rd. - Singapore ranked 2nd out of 144 countries in the Global Information Technology Report 2014 by the [World Economic Forum](/wiki/World_Economic_Forum). - [Networked Readiness Index](/wiki/Networked_Readiness_Index), Singapore ranks 1st out of 139 countries. - [World Intellectual Property Organization](/wiki/World_Intellectual_Property_Organization): [Global Innovation Index](/wiki/Global_Innovation_Index) 2024, ranked 4 out of 133 countries ## Transportation ## Others - Singapore is ranked third among Asian countries in 2014 on Gallup's Potential Net Migration Index. - [Most expensive cities](/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_cities_for_expatriate_employees) — - Economist Intelligence Unit: Cost of Living Survey 2014, ranked 1 out of 140 cities in the world - [Mercer](/wiki/Mercer_(consulting_firm)): Worldwide Cost of Living Survey 2014, ranked 4 out of 211 cities - [List of international rankings](/wiki/List_of_international_rankings) - [Lists of countries](/wiki/Lists_of_countries) - [Lists by country](/wiki/Lists_by_country)
title: International rankings of Singapore
